page.title: 06Village Life - Then & Now.
page.content: In 1922 the major of the manor built the village hall in memory of his son killed at Ypres.In 1925 ownership of the Hall past to a Harley Street doctor.In the late 1960s a large construction company French Kier took over the Hall and set up offices where the old stables had once been. Most of the farm land in the village belongs to descendants of the Stuart family at present there are seven tenant farmers whose main crops are cereals. The village butchers shop which existed for over eighty years has only recently closed gone now also the village wheelwright.the blacksmith and the thatcher.The only surviving shop is the small Post office run by the Meeks family .Most villages shop in nearby towns of St.Neots and Bedford.
